bill_title: create the health and safety facility equity program to assist certain school districts with critical need for capital construction.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to create the facility equity fund to assist certain school districts with critical need for capital construction. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. There is hereby created within the state treasury the facility equity fund to provide funds to assist certain school districts with critical need for capital construction. The fund shall be administered by the secretary of education. Section 2. As used in this Act, a school district with critical need for capital construction is one which: (1) Has an urgent need for a new academic building or for a replacement of an academic building due to a catastrophe or due to condemnation by the state fire marshal for structural concerns; and (2) Levies taxes at the maximum levels prescribed in § 13-6-7 and still does not have the ability to raise local effort sufficient enough to build or acquire adequate, permanent academic building space. Section 3. Any school district seeking financial assistance through the facility equity fund shall apply to the secretary of education. The application shall document the district's critical need and include the district's plan to add or replace the academic building. Section 4. There is hereby created the Facility Equity Fund Oversight Board within the Department of Education. The board shall consist of five members appointed by the Governor. The members shall serve at the pleasure of the Governor. The board shall meet at the call of the secretary of education to review and act upon applications from school districts seeking financial assistance from the facility equity fund. When considering whether to approve an application, the board shall take into consideration the following factors: (1) If the school district is a sparse district as defined in § 13-13-78; (2) If the school district's board has discussed the possibility of reorganizing with the school boards of adjoining school districts, but the adjoining school districts are not interested in reorganization; (3) If the plan to add or replace the academic building is adequate to meet the district's needs, but not excessive based on enrollment projections; and (4) If the district will likely continue to need the planned academic building ten to twenty years into the future. Only those school districts whose applications are approved by the Facility Equity Fund Oversight Board are eligible to receive funds from the facility equity fund. Section 5. The secretary of education shall promulgate rules pursuant to chapter 1-26 to establish application procedures, application timelines, and the procedures for distributing available funds from the facility equity fund to the approved school districts.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to create the heath and safety facility equity program to assist certain school districts with critical need for capital construction. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. There is hereby created within the Department of Education the health and safety facility equity program to assist certain school districts with critical need for capital construction. The program shall be administered by the secretary of education. Section 2. As used in this Act, a school district with critical need for capital construction is one which: (1) Has an urgent need for a new academic building or for a replacement of an academic building due to a catastrophe or due to condemnation by the state fire marshal for structural or health and safety concerns; and (2) Levies taxes at the maximum levels prescribed in § 13-6-7 and still does not have the ability to raise local effort sufficient enough to build or acquire adequate, permanent academic building space. Section 3. Any school district seeking assistance through the health and safety facility equity program shall apply to the secretary of education. The application shall document the district's critical need and include the district's plan to add or replace the academic building. Section 4. There is hereby created the Health and Safety Facility Equity Program Board within the Department of Education. The board shall consist of five members appointed by the Governor. The members shall serve at the pleasure of the Governor. The board shall meet at the call of the secretary of education to review and act upon applications from school districts. When considering whether to approve an application, the board shall take into consideration the following factors: (1) If the school district is a sparse district as defined in § 13-13-78; (2) If the school district's board has discussed the possibility of reorganizing with the school boards of adjoining school districts, but the adjoining school districts are not interested in reorganization; (3) If the plan to add or replace the academic building is adequate to meet the district's needs, but not excessive based on enrollment projections; and (4) If the district will likely continue to need the planned academic building ten to twenty years into the future. All applications approved by the Health and Safety Facility Equity Program Oversight Board shall be forwarded to the Department of Education with recommendations. Section 5. The secretary of education shall promulgate rules pursuant to chapter 1-26 to establish application procedures, application timelines, and the procedures and timelines.
